attributes.action: change the restrictions on Sunday trading to reflect the hours worked by staff, not the hours traded by the store.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The point of restricting the trading hours of large stores on Sundays is to prevent companies forcing their staff to work long shifts on what should be a "family day". This doesn't work, as staff are still made to stock shelves, clean, etc for a full 8 or 9 hour shift, after the store has closed.

I propose that the Sunday trading laws are changed, to prevent any company making any staff member work more than six hours on a Sunday, but allowing the store itself to remain open 24 hours, as they are the rest of the week.

I believe that this way, everybody wins, workers AND shoppers.
